jrtr.gldeferredrenderer

Class GLDeferredRenderContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrtr.gldeferredrenderer.GLDeferredRenderContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RenderContext

    public class GLDeferredRenderContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements RenderContext
    An OpenGL rendering context for rendering with deferred shading, followed by optional post-processing.
    Author:
    Heinrich Reich

      • resize

        public void resize(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Resizes all render targets.
        Parameters:
        drawable -

      • display

        public void display(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Call-back function to draw the scene. Performs deferred shading in two steps. First draw the scene to the g-buffer. Then let the post processors and the second pass drawer manage the perspective. Set the camera into orthogonal mode. Start the second pass drawer. Start the post processors. Draw the final image to the screen. Redo the camera mode.
        Parameters:
        drawable -

      • renderToGBuffer

        protected void renderToGBuffer(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Renders the scene to the g-buffer. Just set the g-buffer as rendering target and do the rendering process with the g-buffer shaders.
        Parameters:
        drawable -

      • changeCameraMode

        private void changeCameraMode()
        Changes the camera mode, so we can draw a quad over the whole screen.

      • redoCameraMode

        private void redoCameraMode()
        Restores the previous camera mode.

      • debugDraw

        protected void debugDraw()
        Draws the g-buffer to the screen for debugging.

      • bindTexture

        public void bindTexture(int textureLocation,
                        int textureId,
                        java.lang.String sampler2DName,
                        GLShader shader)
        Activates a given texture unit, binds a texture to it, and assigns the texture unit to a specified texture in a shader.
        Parameters:
        textureLocation - the OpenGL texture unit that should be used for this texture.
        textureId - the OpenGL reference to the texture to be bound.
        sampler2DName - name of the texture in the shader program.
        shader - the shader program object.

      • drawScreenAlignedQuad

        public void drawScreenAlignedQuad(float x,
                                  float y,
                                  float width,
                                  float height)
        Draws a screen aligned quad in the specified rectangular area (the whole screen is (0,0,1,1).
        Parameters:
        x - see drawScreenAlignedQuad(float, float, float, float)
        y - see drawScreenAlignedQuad(float, float, float, float)
        width - see drawScreenAlignedQuad(float, float, float, float)
        height - see drawScreenAlignedQuad(float, float, float, float)

      • setSceneManager

        public void setSceneManager(SceneManagerInterface sceneManager)
        Set the scene manager. The scene manager contains the 3D scene that will be rendered. The scene includes geometry as well as the camera and viewing frustum.
        Specified by:
        setSceneManager in interface RenderContext

      • beginFrame

        public void beginFrame()
        This method is called at the beginning of each frame, i.e., before scene drawing starts. It clears the color and depth buffers.

      • endFrame

        public void endFrame()
        This method is called at the end of each frame, i.e., after scene drawing is complete.

      • draw

        protected void draw(RenderItem renderItem)
        The main rendering method to draw individual objects. Note that rendering will always (implicitly) draw into the currently bound framebuffer object (FBO).
        Parameters:
        renderItem - the object that needs to be drawn

      • initArrayBuffer

        private void initArrayBuffer(GLVertexData data)
        A utility method to load vertex data into an OpenGL "vertex array object" (VAO) for efficient rendering. The VAO stores several "vertex buffer objects" (VBOs) that contain the vertex attribute data.
        Parameters:
        data - reference to the vertex data to be loaded into a VAO

      • setTransformation

        Sets the perspective to the given transformation and makes sure that the previous camera settings are cached.

        transformation -
